Legal_Issue: Whether the senior immigration officer's decision to refuse landing was in error and if the duty of fairness was breached
Procedural_Context: Judicial review application filed; court reviewed applicable statutes and regulations
Legal_Provision: Under the Immigration Act, a senior immigration officer must hold an inquiry if landing is refused
Basis_of_Claim: Refusal of landing to family members due to concerns over sponsor's residency status
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Existence of an adequate alternative remedy (appeal to the Immigration and Refugee Board)
Review_Outcome: Application dismissed; no question certified; adjourned inquiry should proceed expeditiously
Legal_Standard: Judicial review not available if an adequate alternative remedy exists
Application_Factor: Singh's permanent resident status concerns affecting sponsorship
Decision_Outcome: Refusal of landing deemed valid due to available appeal process
Decision_Review_Issue: Was the refusal of landing in error? Was procedural fairness breached?
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Immigration Act – requirement for inquiry upon refusal of landing
Cause_of_Refusal: Concerns over Singh's permanent resident status
Procedural_Fairness: Issue raised: whether duty of fairness was breached
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenge based on alleged error and breach of fairness
Procedural_Issue: Availability of alternative remedy precluding judicial review
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Deemed inadmissible following concerns about sponsor’s status
